text: Welcome to howtocookthat.net.
I'm Ann Reardon.

Last week we looked at beautiful chocolate
cheesecakes, this week its ugly monkey head

cakes with cheesecake brains and raspberry
sauce.

I'm going to give you a quick two minute round
through on how to make these.

It'll take way too long to film the whole
process so I just give you heads up on how
to do it.

They were for the launch of the Indiana Jones
blue ray DVD set by paramount.

So first of all we took a sweet potato and
carved it into a brain shape.

Then using an edible food gel, I took a cast
of the brain shape, poured cheese cake mixture
into the cast to make four cheesecake brains.

I just colored the cheesecake to make it flesh
toned.

Using bowls as a mould, I've made the base
of the skulls out of white chocolate.

And then using balloons as mould for the top
of the skulls, and then just use a knife to
trim those down.

I made my own bases out of thick cupboard
and aluminum foil then used ganache and chocolate

cake to build up the shape of the face, putting
the skulls in place and building the cake
the whole way up.

Next, mix up some white chocolate ganache
and color it to a flesh tone and cover the
whole thing.

Using the back of a tea spoon, indent with
the eyes are.

Then take some fondant and build it up in
the areas where it needs to be further forward.

Roll out thinly, some grey fondant and place
it over the top of the whole thing including
the top skull.

Using your tools indent and make all of the
shapes and the details you need for the nose

and the face, and put some black fondant in
place for the eyes with a little strip of
white.

Then using black edible food color, add your
details and a little bit pink on the nose
and yellow for those rotten looking teeth.

The top of these skulls didn't need to be
edible, so I used some fluffy string and put
it in place.

If you needed it to be edible you could use
Pashmak or Iranian fairy floss.

But next I placed a thin layer of agar-agar
over the eyes just to give them that little
bit of glossy sheen to them.

Put the cheesecake brains in place in the
skulls, and then using fresh raspberries,

I've made up some raspberry jelly and poured
that over the top to give that gruesome blood
looking effect on top.

And then fluffed up the hair, and there you
have four Indiana Jones monkey heads looking
very gruesome in my fridge there.
